Do you agree with people practicing witchcraft. Personally I think its wonderful, in fact I believ in the religions Wicca. 
 
 And guys I'm talking white magic here, not witches who put hexes on people and are evil bitter people.

 
 True Wiccans do not put "hexes" on people, nor do they cast spells on people...etc. Too many people have seen too many movies.

Phunting

Do you agree with people practicing witchcraft. Personally I think its wonderful, in fact I believ in the religions Wicca. 
Agree? Most defiantly. I don't believe in it as such, though I do have a lot of Pagan sympathies. 
 
 
 
And guys I'm talking white magic here, not witches who put hexes on people and are evil bitter people.
What I don't believe in at all is 'white' and 'black' magic. If such a force exists, it exists as a force that can be used either way, but is not inherently good or evil.
 
 IMHO 'white' magic is just an attempt by Wiccans to distance themselves from the 'witch' stereotype.
Pro-Bush

I am catholic myself, but i was just wondering what do you all mean with "magic"? And what do pagans personally believe? A couple of people at my school are on the Pagan path and both of the are "weird". I'm not trying to say anything about Pagans but they don't fit in to the groups at school.
Darkest Shadow

Aye...christianity, judeism, buddhism...just to put a name to some of the nonsense.

 
 Hey! Please don't do that, that's an insult.
 
 
 
 To answer the question, I'm a Christian and I believe witchcraft is wrong. And as I believe most Wiccans worship some Goddess or other and practice witchcraft, I believe Wicca is wrong. However, it IS a free country and you can practice it if you want. (I have a good online friend who's a wiccan....yes we had a HUGE debate)
sundowner

[QUOTE=Darkest Shadow]Hey! Please don't do that, that's an insult.
 
 It was not meant to be an insult, it was in response to post number 2. I was trying to point out that this "nonsense" has a name, in fact, many names. I will not be like some people and say that any religion other than mine is wrong, nor will I tell people what they should believe...religion is an individual concept.
Phunting

I am catholic myself, but i was just wondering what do you all mean with "magic"? And what do pagans personally believe? A couple of people at my school are on the Pagan path and both of the are "weird". I'm not trying to say anything about Pagans but they don't fit in to the groups at school.
I'm not surprised they are different. To be a Pagan in a Christian dominated society you must make an active stance in breaking with tradition and 'normality' by definition. It is therefore understandable that they wouldn't 'fit in' as seamlessly as others. Of course this is a generalisation, but still true to an extent.
 
 'Magic' in the Pagan religions is generally the channelling and use of 'natural' energy and will power to make changes in the world of varying extents.
 
 And while we're on the subject of definitions, Wicca itself isn't (as the thread title appears to assume) a form of witchcraft as such. Wicca is a Pagan religion, whos followers usually, but not always, use witchcraft.
SirGladius

Do you agree with people practicing witchcraft. Personally I think its wonderful, in fact I believ in the religions Wicca. 
 
 And guys I'm talking white magic here, not witches who put hexes on people and are evil bitter people.

 
 Hey whatever you want to do with your life is your business, who am I to tell you that your way of life is wrong. Just don't tell me mine is wrong and we'll have no serious problems
